body: My wife has secondary breast cancer and was experiencing alot of pain. After calling the oncology helpline we made our way to the cancer centre level 2 ward B. From the moment we entered the nurse Charlotte put us at ease and told us that the Doctor would be in ASAP. The doctor arrived (Adrian) and although he had questions to ask he could see the pain my wife was experiencing and asked for medication to be administered straight away. He was very professional and took all the time my wife needed to discuss her symptoms. He spent and while and reassured us that we would get the right help. He popped in and out the whole night to ensure things had settled. Charlotte continued to nurse my wife through the night. I think both of these staff did BCH proud and it was clear to see their compassion for not only their patient but worries spouse. My wife spent 3 days in ward B and the staff have been amazing, clearly working to the values for all the HSC pride themselves in. Thanks so much to all but in particular Adrian and Charlotte who looked after my wife so well well she was at her worst.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: redeg74
title: Suspicious Mole removal
body: I went into the Ambulatory care unit at FVRH to get a mole on my back removed to be sent for biopsy.   David and Lee-Ann carried out the procedure.   Right from meeting them they made me feel at ease and showed so much care and empathy towards me as I was really worried.   Everything was explained to me fully and I was updated at every step with what they were doing.   David and Lee-Ann worked so well together and is evident what a strong team they are.   They spoke to me throughout to keep me calm and provided me the support I needed due to not being able to have anyone with me.   They are both an asset to your workforce.   Thank you so much.

author: lepusgk33
title: Care in University Hospital Wishaw
body: My husband was recently admitted to Wishaw General hospital for an operation.I want to thank all the staff involved in his care. Their humour and kindness made the journey much easier. Special mention for Mr Komolafe and his team, pre assessment, ward 13 and surgical ambulatory care. The care and attention was fantastic. I would also like to thank the wider team: pharmacy, physio and acute pain nurse. It has been a difficult year for everyone but staff get up in the morning, come to their work and do the best for their patients with professionalism, kindness and a smile. Thank you so much.

title: Excellent care in Gynaecology
body:
I wanted to thank the receptionist, nurse and Nurse Practitioner that I saw today. The professionalism and warmth put me greatly at ease.
I appreciate this level of care, particularly knowing how difficult things have been for NHS during the pandemic. First-rate service.

author: ospreyyc35
title: amazing care
body:
My sister in law was admitted to Ward 18 Wishaw General in March and was admitted to SACU and then ward 18 while waiting for a transfer to Ward 6 in Monklands.  
The care she received for staff in both wards was excellent and we would like to thank the staff in Wishaw wards.  
In Monklands she had large renal stones removed under anesthesia and the care she had from all staff in ward 6 and surgery was amazing.

author: atlaspb47
title: All of these beautiful people made me feel safe
body:
A&E - In A&E with covid positive I was surrounded by doctors/nurses 2 days 100% dedication.  
Medical Ward - The care provided by all care team from doctors/nurses/cleaners/tea-dinner service.  
Some of the stars during my treatment of 11 days:-  
Grace  
Christine x 2  
Roel  
Marjorie  
Lynn  
Ricky  
Alan  
Steven  
Emma  
Anne  
Maureen  
Rachel  
Tara  
All of these beautiful people made me feel safe, secure and comfortable during my bad times and never left me alone.  
All of these people are in the care system for a reason. It's more than just a calling they are caring.  
There is nothing I can add in a negative way.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Brilliant department.
body: I  was treated  and had surgery in Urology dept at City Hospital Nottingham and my care was of the best.  The speed  of my operation from diagnosis was unbelievably fast. I had a kidney removed with tumour removed and recovered very well.  My surgeon and all his team plus all the staff were exceptional.  I couldn't have been better looked after. At 77 years of age it was a worrying time for me and my family, now we are very grateful to all.  Can't thank them enough.

author: geminihe83
title: Let down by my rheumatologist
body:
I had pain in my right temple and had to go urgently to A& E as advised by my GP and 111. I was put on steroids straightaway for 5 days. On the 6th day I had Temporal Biopsy and had 14 stitches.  
My results were supposed to go straight to my Rheumatologist after 1 week. I waited for over 3 weeks for them to contact me but he didn't. I was supposed to go back on steroids after my biopsy. So I missed 3 weeks of those tablets. Then one day they ring me to tell me my results were negative! Whew! I waited over 3 weeks for my results.  
Rheumatologist then sent me for further tests ie.... Blood tests and head scan. And asked me if I could have face to face consultation which I agreed. On the day of my head scan, the radiographer couldn't any artery on the right side of my temple/head. He said I might have to have CT scan and had sent my scan results straightaway to my rheumatologist and he might contact me the next day to see what next step would be for me. Now its been over 1 week of waiting for my rhumatologist to get in touch with me! ! ! !  
I contacted the secretary three times, I left messages over the phone as I was advised by my rheumatologist in case I needed to contact them. Eventually the secretary rang me and was quite rude. They said they couldn't contact the dr as this is not the way it works! I explained that as a secretary with contact with the dr, I just needed to speak to them as I had so much pressure behind my eyes due to high dose of steroids. The secretary wasn't helpful at all and instead told me to contact nurses station at rheumatology dept.  
I rang 111 who advised me to go straight to Queens Hospital at Urgent Eye Clinic which I did and ended up with 2 eyedrops as I had lots of inflammation behind my eyes When I contacted Nurses station at KGH, a really nice, kind person answered the fone and said it was the secretary's to job but they would help me. They left an email for my rheumatologist, who I'm still waiting for to contact me.  
My appt last year in march was cancelled and I havent been given any other appt for follow up for my arthritis either. I'm not holding my breath for my rhumatologist to contact me. I want to know how to change my consultant for another one who will take my serious medical problems seriously. I still can go blind with Temperal Arteritis as I am not being given aftercare. I'm still on steroids. I havnt had my blood pressure checked or had test for diabetes which can occur with Steroids.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Nicola83
title: My diagnosis and illness
body: I was diagnosed with bowel cancer last week and told 4 days later it was stage 4. It's been a very difficult time for the family and my symptoms were meaning I had no energy and was very sick and sore. I was lucky to have the district nurse team call to do my syringe driver to try to manage the symptoms. Not having to leave my home and getting the time with my family has been invaluable. The nurses are fantastic, so caring professional and attentive. I could not ask for better. My only recommendation would be that their role is extended. If I need fluids I have to be readmitted to hospital. Due to my age I am not eligible for acute care at home. I would hate to need hospital admission. Due to covid and no visiting it would mean my now restricted time is spent away from the people I love. This needs reviewed Asap for all those in my position.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Disgusting attitude towards suicidal patient
body: I’ve been meaning to leave this review for some time. I contacted The Limes on behalf of a family member (a Limes patient) who confided in me and told me they were suicidal. I called up and due to covid was diverted to Epping. The receptionist was so UNBELIEVABLY rude and uncaring. I was shocked. I hung up the phone and cried! What if my family member had plucked up the courage to make the call themselves and received this kind of reaction? Who knows what could have happened.  I then later went into the Waltham Abbey practice and spoke to one of the absolutely lovely ladies in there and she got us sorted with an appointment. I raised a complaint with Epping and never heard back. Disgraceful.

author: Barry123
title: She's absolutely brilliant
body: I have regular visits from a community matron called Kath and she's absolutely brilliant. She's helped and still helps me in so many different ways, from helping me stay out of hospital to supporting me and getting things arranged for me and helping me in so many ways.. Without her I don't know where I would be shes great and I couldn't be without her. Thank you for all you do: )

author: Washbucket
title: Mental Health
body: My family member is cared for in the community under a compulsory treatment order. About two years ago they got a new keyworker who expressed a lack of interest in keeping the family involved, despite the family having to step in on many occasions to rescue our loved one from various adverse events and circumstances. The police came to us looking for our loved one, but it transpired that they had just gone on holiday abroad. Despite this holiday being approved by staff, they were unable to make this known to the police, but they told the family when we asked. We carried on as normal, with communication being one-way from us, as sometimes happened. About six months later we were advised by the Housing Association that they had not been resident all this time and the tenancy had been lost. They had not returned from holiday. We approached their team who confirmed this. Alone, abroad, unmedicated, uncared-for, friendless, they came to serious harm. We feel excluded, angry, distressed, and fearful for their future in a system which is not capable of configuring itself to provide basic safety and a decent way of life to our loved one, despite the family's willingness to help.

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Disgusting communication
body: Rang for an appointment to get a sick note. Not given a time when the docotr will call to discuss this with me just told "some point this morning" I miss the call as I didn't get my phone quick enough so call back within a minute of missing the call and I was on the line for over 15 minutes with the phone just ringing not on hold or anything and no one ever answered the phone and no way of leaving a message. And the doctor did not leave a message or call me back.

title: C3 ward - Adie
body: Id just like to say, that even though i had a short stay on the C3 ward, that everyone who works on that ward do an absoltely amazing job, they go above and beyond what is expected of them and defintely do more than what they are paid to do, ive never met such amazing, caring, nice people in my entire life. you can cleary tell that each and eveyone of them love there job and genuinelly care about all the patients on the ward, i feel so proud of all them yor all amazing, keep up the the amazing and caring work you do, which i have no doubt in my mind you will. all my love, Adie

title: Going the extra mile
body:
I am not a patient but I am a GP in the Midlands and today one of your reception staff spoke to a close family member of mine who was distressed.

The individual concerned went the extra mile and listened to her and also sorted out an appointment.

The conversation was really helpful in itself. I know how pressured reception is but you really went the extra mile today and I want to thank you for your care. It was exemplary

title: audiology brilliant service
body: I went for a hearing test on 29th March as I thought my aids needing replacing. I had a brilliant test and was given new aids as my hearing had deteriorated and the person doing the test explained everything perfectly I can't praise the service enough

readBy.name: Wrightington, Wigan and Leigh NHS Trust

title: Amazing care
body: The student nurse who was with me in my procedure today was absolutely fantastic and made me feel so at ease. The whole team cared for me so well and did it nice and quickly. Big Thankyou! Also they made sure I never lost any dignity throughout it all.
